rev.comment: as far as I know, not all apps work offline
rev.diff:
Line 76: Line 76:
==Applications==
==Applications==
â
AIR applications can operate offline, and then activate further functionality or upload data when an active Internet connection becomes available. One example is ''eBay Desktop'',<ref>http://desktop.ebay.com/</ref> which allows sellers to complete a listing offline and then upload it to [[eBay]] when they are connected to the Internet. Also, ''[[League of Legends]]'' by [[Riot Games]] uses AIR's technology for its game client. Another example is the NYTimes Reader 2.0, which allows you to download a newspaper and then read it offline, with news updates available once it connects again.<ref name="eBay Desktop">{{cite web|url=http://www.adobe.com/devnet/air/ajax/articles/air_ajax_developers_02.html|title=Introducing Adobe AIR for Ajax developers (pg. 2)|accessdate=2009-05-24}}</ref> Other companies using AIR include [[AOL]], [[NASDAQ]], [[Yahoo!]], [[FedEx]], the [[BBC]]<ref>http://iplayerhelp.external.bbc.co.uk/help/download_programmes/desktop_requirements</ref> and [[BNP Paribas]].<ref name="showcase">
+
Some AIR applications can operate offline, and then activate further functionality or upload data when an active Internet connection becomes available. One example is ''eBay Desktop'',<ref>http://desktop.ebay.com/</ref> which allows sellers to complete a listing offline and then upload it to [[eBay]] when they are connected to the Internet. Also, ''[[League of Legends]]'' by [[Riot Games]] uses AIR's technology for its game client. Another example is the NYTimes Reader 2.0, which allows you to download a newspaper and then read it offline, with news updates available once it connects again.<ref name="eBay Desktop">{{cite web|url=http://www.adobe.com/devnet/air/ajax/articles/air_ajax_developers_02.html|title=Introducing Adobe AIR for Ajax developers (pg. 2)|accessdate=2009-05-24}}</ref> Other companies using AIR include [[AOL]], [[NASDAQ]], [[Yahoo!]], [[FedEx]], the [[BBC]]<ref>http://iplayerhelp.external.bbc.co.uk/help/download_programmes/desktop_requirements</ref> and [[BNP Paribas]].<ref name="showcase">
{{cite web|url=http://www.adobe.com/products/air/showcase/|title=Adobe AIR showcase|publisher=[[Adobe Systems]]|accessdate=2008-07-11}}</ref> Over 520 applications are available on the Adobe AIR marketplace.<ref name="Adobe AIR Marketplace">{{cite web|url=http://www.adobe.com/cfusion/exchange/index.cfm?event=productHome&exc=24&loc=en_us|title=Adobe AIR Marketplace|accessdate=2009-05-24}}</ref>
{{cite web|url=http://www.adobe.com/products/air/showcase/|title=Adobe AIR showcase|publisher=[[Adobe Systems]]|accessdate=2008-07-11}}</ref> Over 520 applications are available on the Adobe AIR marketplace.<ref name="Adobe AIR Marketplace">{{cite web|url=http://www.adobe.com/cfusion/exchange/index.cfm?event=productHome&exc=24&loc=en_us|title=Adobe AIR Marketplace|accessdate=2009-05-24}}</ref>
